001/*

004 */
005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
011
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyAtomicItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
015
016import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLEventReader2;
017import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamWriter2;
018import org.codehaus.stax2.evt.XMLEventFactory2;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.lang.reflect.Field;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.function.Supplier;
024
025import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
026import javax.xml.stream.XMLEventWriter;
027import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException;
028import javax.xml.stream.events.StartElement;
029import javax.xml.stream.events.XMLEvent;
030
031import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
032
033/**
034 * Represents a data type implementation.
035 *
036 * @param <TYPE>
037 *          the Java type of the underlying data value
038 */
039public interface IDataTypeAdapter<TYPE> {
040
041  /**
042   * Get the metaschema type names associated with this adapter. This name must be
043   * unique with respect to all other metaschema types.
044   * <p>
045   * At least one name must be provided, with the first name being the most
046   * preferred name.
047   *
048   * @return the name
049   */
050  @NonNull
051  List<QName> getNames();
052
053  /**
054   * Get the most preferred name for this data type.
055   *
056   * @return the name
057   */
058  @NonNull
059  default QName getPreferredName() {
060    return ObjectUtils.notNull(getNames().iterator().next());
061  }
062
063  /**
064   * The JSON primative type of the data type.
065   *
066   * @return the JSON data type
067   */
068  JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType();
069
070  /**
071   * Get the Java class supported by this adapter.
072   *
073   * @return the Java class
074   */
075  @NonNull
076  Class<TYPE> getJavaClass();
077
078  /**
079   * Casts the provided value to the type associated with this adapter.
080   *
081   * @param value
082   *          a value of the provided type
083   * @return the typed value
084   */
085  @NonNull
086  TYPE toValue(@NonNull Object value);
087
088  /**
089   * Gets the value as a string suitable for writing as text. This is intended for
090   * data types that have a simple string-based structure in XML and JSON, such as
091   * for XML attributes or JSON keys. An adapter for a complex data structures
092   * that consist of XML elements will throw an
093   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when this is called.
094   *
095   * @param value
096   *          the data to formatted as a string
097   * @return a string
098   * @throws UnsupportedOperationException
099   *           if the data type cannot be represented as a string
100   */
101  @NonNull
102  String asString(@NonNull Object value);
103
104  /**
105   * Create a copy of the provided value.
106   *
107   * @param obj
108   *          the value to copy
109   * @return the copy
110   */
111  @NonNull
112  TYPE copy(@NonNull Object obj);
113
114  /**
115   * Determines if the data type is an atomic, scalar value. Complex structures
116   * such as Markup are not considered atomic.
117   *
118   * @return {@code true} if the data type is an atomic scalar value, or
119   *         {@code false} otherwise
120   */
121  default boolean isAtomic() {
122    return true;
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Get the java type of the associated item.
127   *
128   * @return the java associated item type
129   */
130  @NonNull
131  Class<? extends IAnyAtomicItem> getItemClass();
132
133  /**
134   * Construct a new item of this type using the provided value.
135   *
136   * @param value
137   *          the item's value
138   * @return a new item
139   */
140  // TODO: markup types are not atomic values.
141  // Figure out a better base type (i.e., IValuedItem)
142  @NonNull
143  IAnyAtomicItem newItem(@NonNull Object value);
144
145  /**
146   * Cast the provided item to an item of this type, if possible.
147   *
148   * @param item
149   *          the atomic item to cast
150   * @return an atomic item of this type
151   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
152   *           if the provided item type cannot be cast to this item type
153   */
154  @NonNull
155  IAnyAtomicItem cast(IAnyAtomicItem item);
156
157  /**
158   * Determines if adapter can parse the next element. The next element's
159   * {@link QName} is provided for this purpose.
160   * <p>
161   * This will be called when the parser encounter's an element it does not
162   * recognize. This gives the adapter a chance to request parsing of the data.
163   *
164   * @param nextElementQName
165   *          the next element's namespace-qualified name
166   * @return {@code true} if the adapter will parse the element, or {@code false}
167   *         otherwise
168   */
169  boolean canHandleQName(@NonNull QName nextElementQName);
170
171  /**
172   * Parses a provided string. Used to parse XML attributes, simple XML character
173   * data, and JSON/YAML property values.
174   *
175   * @param value
176   *          the string value to parse
177   * @return the parsed data as the adapter's type
178   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
179   *           if the data is not valid to the data type
180   */
181  @NonNull
182  TYPE parse(@NonNull String value);
183
184  /**
185   * This method is expected to parse content starting at the next event. Parsing
186   * will continue until the next event represents content that is not handled by
187   * this adapter. This means the event stream should be positioned after any
188   * {@link XMLEvent#END_ELEMENT} that corresponds to an
189   * {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} parsed by this adapter.
190   * <p>
191   * If this method parses the {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} for the element that
192   * contains the value data, then this method must also parse the corresponding
193   * {@link XMLEvent#END_ELEMENT}. Otherwise, the first event to parse will be the
194   * value data.
195   * <p>
196   * The value data is expected to be parsed completely, leaving the event stream
197   * on a peeked event corresponding to content that is not handled by this
198   * method.
199   *
200   * @param eventReader
201   *          the XML parser used to read the parsed value
202   * @return the parsed value
203   * @throws IOException
204   *           if a parsing error occurs
205   */
206  @NonNull
207  TYPE parse(@NonNull XMLEventReader2 eventReader) throws IOException;
208
209  /**
210   * Parses a JSON property value.
211   *
212   * @param parser
213   *          the JSON parser used to read the parsed value
214   * @return the parsed value
215   * @throws IOException
216   *           if a parsing error occurs
217   */
218  @NonNull
219  TYPE parse(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException;
220
221  /**
222   * Parses a provided string using {@link #parse(String)}.
223   * <p>
224   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
225   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
226   *
227   * @param value
228   *          the string value to parse
229   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
230   * @throws IOException
231   *           if an error occurs while parsing
232   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
233   *           if the provided value is invalid based on the data type
234   * @see #parse(String)
235   */
236  @NonNull
237  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull String value) throws IOException {
238    TYPE retval = parse(value);
239    return () -> copy(retval);
240  }
241
242  /**
243   * Parses a provided string using
244   * {@link IDataTypeAdapter#parse(XMLEventReader2)}.
245   * <p>
246   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
247   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
248   *
249   * @param eventReader
250   *          the XML parser used to read the parsed value
251   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
252   * @throws IOException
253   *           if an error occurs while parsing
254   * @see #parse(String)
255   * @see #parse(XMLEventReader2)
256   */
257  @NonNull
258  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull XMLEventReader2 eventReader) throws IOException {
259    TYPE retval = parse(eventReader);
260    return () -> copy(retval);
261  }
262
263  /**
264   * Parses a provided string using {@link #parse(JsonParser)}.
265   * <p>
266   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
267   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
268   *
269   * @param parser
270   *          the JSON parser used to read the parsed value
271   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
272   * @throws IOException
273   *           if an error occurs while parsing
274   * @see #parse(String)
275   * @see #parse(JsonParser)
276   */
277  @NonNull
278  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException {
279    TYPE retval = parse(parser);
280    return () -> copy(retval);
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * Writes the provided Java class instance data as XML. The parent element
285   * information is provided as a {@link StartElement} event, which allows
286   * namespace information to be obtained from the parent element using the
287   * {@link StartElement#getName()} and {@link StartElement#getNamespaceContext()}
288   * methods, which can be used when writing the provided instance value.
289   *
290   * @param instance
291   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
292   * @param parent
293   *          the {@link StartElement} XML event that is the parent of the data to
294   *          write
295   * @param eventFactory
296   *          the XML event factory used to generate XML writing events
297   * @param eventWriter
298   *          the XML writer used to output XML as events
299   * @throws XMLStreamException
300   *           if an unexpected error occurred while processing the XML output
301   * @throws IOException
302   *           if an unexpected error occurred while writing to the output stream
303   */
304  void writeXmlValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull StartElement parent, @NonNull XMLEventFactory2 eventFactory,
305      @NonNull XMLEventWriter eventWriter)
306      throws IOException, XMLStreamException;
307
308  /**
309   * Writes the provided Java class instance data as XML. The parent element
310   * information is provided as an XML {@link QName}, which allows namespace
311   * information to be obtained from the parent element. Additional namespace
312   * information can be gathered using the
313   * {@link XMLStreamWriter2#getNamespaceContext()} method, which can be used when
314   * writing the provided instance value.
315   *
316   * @param instance
317   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
318   * @param parentName
319   *          the qualified name of the XML data's parent element
320   * @param writer
321   *          the XML writer used to output the XML data
322   * @throws XMLStreamException
323   *           if an unexpected error occurred while processing the XML output
324   */
325  void writeXmlValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull QName parentName, @NonNull XMLStreamWriter2 writer)
326      throws XMLStreamException;
327
328  /**
329   * Writes the provided Java class instance as a JSON/YAML field value.
330   *
331   * @param instance
332   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
333   * @param writer
334   *          the JSON/YAML writer used to output the JSON/YAML data
335   * @throws IOException
336   *           if an unexpected error occurred while writing the JSON/YAML output
337   */
338  void writeJsonValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull JsonGenerator writer) throws IOException;
339
340  /**
341   * Gets the default value to use as the JSON/YAML field name for a Metaschema
342   * field value if no JSON value key flag or name is configured.
343   *
344   * @return the default field name to use
345   */
346  @NonNull
347  String getDefaultJsonValueKey();
348
349  /**
350   * Determines if the data type's value is allowed to be unwrapped in XML when
351   * the value is a field value.
352   *
353   * @return {@code true} if allowed, or {@code false} otherwise.
354   */
355  boolean isUnrappedValueAllowedInXml();
356
357  /**
358   * Determines if the datatype uses mixed text and element content in XML.
359   *
360   * @return {@code true} if the datatype uses mixed text and element content in
361   *         XML, or {@code false} otherwise
362   */
363  boolean isXmlMixed();
364}
